results.description:
Peru being one of the most emerging countries in South America in the last decade and one of the first countries in Latin America, I saw the necessity to create a group for all the Peruvian' professionals in New York to demonstrate that here we also distinguish ourselves occupying important places and working together to grow stronger...our Peruvian community in the United States can do the same!! As a proud Peruvian and owner of two real estate offices in Astoria and LIC, Queens, I invite you to participate in this group with the main purpose to exchange business to gain more referrals/clients. This group is perfect for entrepreneur, professionals, CEO's, Lawyers, Architects, Engineers, Real Estate agents/Brokers, Salespersons and Business owners. 

Siendo Perú uno de los países más emergentes de Sudamérica en la última era y posicionado en uno de los primeros lugares de América Latina, vi la necesidad de crear un grupo para todos los profesionales peruanos en New York para demostrar que aquí también destacamos y ocupamos puestos importantes y que trabajando juntos podemos crecer mas fuertes. Personalmente creo que nuestra comunidad peruana en los Estados Unidos puede hacer lo mismo. Destacar en los primeros lugares en la política, negocios, y en el ejercicio profesional de nuestras carreras. Como una orgullosa peruana dueña de una oficina de agentes inmobiliarios in Astoria y Long Island City, Queens; te invito a que participes de este grupo con el principal objetivo de hacer negocios. Este grupo es perfecto para emprendedores, profesionales, ejecutivos, abogados, arquitectos, ingenieros, agentes y corredores inmobiliarios, vendedores y dueños de empresas.
results.name: Peruvian Professionals & Business Owners Group

results.description:
If you like the idea of having a place where you can (1) put some work on stage, before an audience of peers, in a spirit of experimentation AND/OR (2) watch and support your fellow artists doing the same . . . then this "group" is for you!

We meet most Monday nights.  At INTAR Theatre. 

You get to stage whatever you want:  something "perfected" or a work in progress; something original or something well known; an excerpt from a one-person show or a scene with numerous characters; it can be anything.  (Within reason. :))  The stage is yours for ten minutes.

Or simply sit back and be inspired and entertained.  (Never any pressure to perform.)

It's all followed by an informal soiree centered in the theater's bar/lounge area!
results.name: Actors' Monday Night Performance Lab @ INTAR Theatre

results.description:
Are you ready for a new beginning as a man? 

The men's movement has been growing steadily for years. Some men have been to retreats and others have joined weekly circles to find their brothers. The goal is simple - to reconnect with the lineage of real masculinity, one that includes all of the complex emotions that men experience and rarely share. In a sacred and confidential men's circle, we step into a world where men can say and hear things that we've longed to express. This honesty and vulnerability allows us to unearth buried emotions and begin to let them go quite naturally. This is vitally important work for ourselves and for our fellow men. Our planet and our children depend upon us to create a new awareness based upon these ancient traditions. What is a typical evening like? Every month, we will gather twice. 

Not sure this is for you? Try Session 1 ($25) and pay the balance at the second session if it works for your needs! Thanks to our brother, Jeff, for suggesting this great idea to open the door for more men!

The structure will be very simple: 7:00 - 8:00 pm Meditation and Gentle Kripalu Yoga 8:00 - 9:30 pm Open Circle. Who is this program for? Men of any age or background who have a willingness to unite their spiritual, physical and mental selves. Per the schedule, we will be doing some yoga and meditation. Don't worry if you are new to these practices. The atmosphere will be one where men of all abilities are welcome! Can I come for just part of the evening? No. Our goal is to have everyone take part in the entire process. If you have a physical condition that prohibits you from taking part in the yoga, please confer with the teacher who will offer you modifications so that you can participate. For more information, visit us at: www.rivertownyoga.com/mens-open-circle

$199 for 8 Sessions payable in full by Session 2. Some limited scholarships are available. Contact scottbierko@gmail.com for information.

Dates:  September 10 and 24; October 8 and 29, November 12 and 19; December 10 and 17
results.name: NEW Men's Open Circle in Dobbs Ferry, NY

results.description:
Hello fellow wine lovers. This meetup will provide an opportunity for gay men with an interest in wine and food to meet each other and explore various categories of wine while dining out in New York BYOB restaurants.

For each dinner meetup, a theme will be chosen and the wines will be provided by the host, who will disclose the identities of the wines (along with ratings, reviews, and prices) when the meetup is announced. The wines will be carefully chosen as good examples of their type and offer a good price-quality ratio. To facilitate dinner-table discussions and to ensure that everyone is able to taste and retaste all the wines, attendance will be capped at 10 men per dinner. To cover the cost of the wines, attendees will pay a fee when RSVPing. Then at the restaurant, each attendee will pay for whatever food he orders.

I am the organizer of an identical (though not gay-specific) meetup group based in Westchester County. It has proven very successful over the past year, and it made me want to launch a New York City version just for gay men who have some knowledge of wine and want to expand their tasting experience and meet other guys who share their interest. Check out my Westchester group to get an idea of what the events are like:
http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-BYOB-Wine-Tasting-Group...

I've earned the Diploma of Wines and Spirits from the Wine and Spirit Education Trust, and look forward to sharing some interesting bottles over good food and conversation.
Tom
results.name: NYC Gay Men's Wine Dinner Group

results.description:
Financial freedom has been broadly defined as having sufficient resources to do what you want to do without having to depend on a job. But freedom comes with responsibility, and those who have achieved it know that they have to be vigilant and disciplined. This group is an ongoing, self-directed workshop to help people who have reached financial freedom or who are well along the path to achieving it. Going way beyond discussion, we will share resources, explore tools and strategies, and monitor our progress with exercises and activities proposed by respected sources such as LearnVest and Financial Integrity.

This group is for:

•  people who define financial freedom as never having to make a money decision because they HAVE to do something, but only because they WANT to do it

•  people who have sufficient resources to maintain their lifestyle without having to depend on a job, on credit cards, on handouts, or on anything other than themselves

•  people who don't depend on a nine-to-five job for the resources they need to survive and thrive

•  people who own their time and can spend it as they wish, whether on business projects, charitable endeavors, family activities, hobbies, or just plain having fun

•  people who want to permanently uncouple themselves from the spend-pay-spend-pay rat race to focus on relationships, experiences, and joy 

• people who enjoy studying and learning about advanced financial strategies to preserve and grow their wealth
results.name: Financial Freedom Fighters - Wealth Accountability Partners

results.description:
Do you have many interests/hobbies? Do you try to excel in many areas when others normally just focus on one?

This group is for those who have strong interests/talents across many fields, both artistic and technical - ideally those like myself who are passionate about at least a few, if not all, of the following: Programming + Film/Animation + Music/Piano + Graphics + Games + Web/Mobile + Business/Finance + Writing + Travel/World Domination.

You don't have be an expert, and I probably wouldn't want to meet you if you were a prick about how much you knew. At the same time, this isn't a group for dabblers, so wanting to try many things but not really try that hard doesn't quite cut it either. :P

I'm looking to meet others who want to do more than put themselves on a specialized, narrow career path after college with nothing outside that. There's a certain big-picture view you get when you are genuinely interested in subjects across many areas, and it'd be fun to meet others who can relate to that.

Activities in this group can range from just for fun activities, like mixers and hangouts, to more creative projects depending on the talents we get. I'm hoping eventually we can help each other on our own projects and then collaborate on more ambitious ideas down the line... Maybe if we get enough talent together, we could even start a company and take over the world!!! Bahahaha!

(just kidding ^_^ ...maybe)

Feel free to suggest events or step up for co-organizing.  I'll be traveling a lot so I won't be able to host too frequently.

results.description:

I recently graduated a couple years ago myself, traded at hedge funds for a few years, and automated my trading on a system I built myself called Tech Trader (http://techtrader.ai), which mainly uses Technical Analysis and has been running live for about 3 years completely hands off. 

I'm curious to see what others have done and am interested in bouncing ideas or collaborating on projects. Some personal goals of mine are just finding other people who are also automating their trading and perhaps teaming up on some trading strategies or ideas, as some of what I want to do is now beyond my own capabilities. Also just more fun to work in a team rather than go about it solo. :P

Feel free to suggest events or step up for co-organizing.  I'll be traveling a lot so I won't be able to host too frequently.

topics.name: Personal Finance Improvement  & Get Out of Debt

results.description:
Although we live in the information age, people are even more confused and have little knowledge about how money works.

In terms of saving, people don’t save enough. Not only that, they are in debt. A good portion of the working classes’ income goes to paying all sorts of loans from mortgages, credit cards, car loans, and student loans. People are approached everyday to get new credit cards or refinance their mortgage. They are asked to SPEND rather than SAVE. Despite enjoying the biggest per capita income in the world, our BIGGEST PROBLEM IS MONEY.

For those who save, they put money in savings accounts that pay too little to offset inflation and taxes. In fact, THEY’RE LOSING THEIR MONEY!

For those who invest, they put money into RISKY investment vehicles. Most people buy stock by the recommendation of friends and coworkers. They also put money into their pension in the company they work for and trust that it will be there when they retire. It’s not always the case.

The lack of insurance protection along with the shortage of retirement savings are TICKING TIME BOMBS FOR MOST FAMILIES. That is NOT CONSIDERING the looming problem of health care costs and long-term care in old age.

The BIGGEST CRISIS we’re facing is not terrorism, global warming, or political stalemate. It’s the RETIREMENT CRISIS!

BAD investments, RISKY derivatives practices, short-term profit MOTIVES and bigger Wall Street BONUSES have put investors in a world of hurt and the country in depression. People lost HUGE amounts of their RETIREMENT and large EQUITY in their home. Debt, bankruptcy, and foreclosure CONTINUE to mount.

Sadly, most agents nowadays are MORE FOCUSED on the upper market and DO NOT want to spend time with the AVERAGE WORKING FAMILY.

THAT IS WHY WE ARE HERE! We want to help solve the consumer's DILEMMA of LACK OF UNDERSTANDING, PLANNING, AND SUPPORT!
results.name: Financial Literacy Seminars

results.description:
This meetup group is for those interested in training in Danzan Ryu Jujitsu (also referred to as DZR). The art is very similar to Judo (and has roots in Kodokan Judo), but the training is less sport oriented. A large amount of training is focused on self defense.  We do have members that will compete in Judo competitions, and do quite well.

Currently, we train under Sensei J.C. Islander.  He holds a black belt in Danzan Ryu Jujitsu. He received his 4th degree black belt in Karate Do under Kaicho Tadashi Nakamura. He received his 2nd degree black belt in Ying Jow Pai (Northern Eagle Claw) under Sifu Shum Leung. Sensei Islander is also proficient in Wu style Tai Chi Chuan with 8 years of intensive study. He has competed in a number of full-contact Karate, Judo, and Jujitsu tournaments.
results.name: Danzan-Ryu Jujitsu NYC

results.description: If you are a novice poker player, an aspiring amateur, or just a weekend warrior who wants to improve your game, than this group is for you. To be run by the members - any member who wants to be an assistant organizer will be granted! To be a fun place for all to play our favorite game. This was the original vision, We still honor that!!! Poker Meetup Group, Welcome!! Meet local Poker faces to test your hand against us in a Texas Holdem low-stakes This group is for people who love to play the game of poker in a non-threatening atmosphere while meeting new people. All guests should respect the rules and procedures of the host and the other people the host designates as an authority for the game. I learned the importance of networking with others in the business is how to get successful deals done. Looking forward to exploring great opportunity with everybody.”

This investor networking group is to seal the deal and make true reality connections with people that are at the top of their career and looking to find themselves in others. We also welcome business professional to join this group for professional networking even if they are not tied into the real estate community and looking to build their professional network. The main focus is to bring the following striving entrepreneurs together. 

Members that we would love to join this group are experienced and up coming investors, appraisers, mortgage brokers/ loan offers, title companies, hard money lenders, conventional banks/lenders, architects, engineers, interior designers, developers, contractor's/trades men, home inspectors, cleaning services, landscapers, real estate brokers/ agents, property managers and wholesalers.

results.description:
The Fro-life * Fro-choice Movement empowers and uplifts all women and men regardless of their hair preference, focusing less on what we do with our hair, and more on why we do it. 

Rather than grouping ourselves absurdly as “team natural” or “team processed”, this movement uses two identifiers to help in distinguishing one’s preference of how to wear his/her hair: FroLife and FroChoice.

*FroLife* -- the principled belief that one should wear his/her hair naturally, and only naturally. This will vary based on an individual’s boundaries in defining natural hair.

*FroChoice* -- the belief that an individual should wear one’s hair as he or she chooses, whether that is straight, in braided or weaved extensions, or in a natural style.

This is an extended campaign about self-reflection and love. FLFC does not promote a single idea, instead it embraces the opinions and stories of all people, whose identities have at all been affected by hair.
results.name: The Fro-life * Fro-Choice Movement

results.description:
NYC sucks, but guess what? You're here. And, seeing as how you've ended up on this page, there's a 96% chance that you're alllllllll alone. 

Maybe you don't feel like joining the other 734 Meetups catering to 20-something lonely girls because the number of exclamation points used in every title!!!!!!! and description!!!!!!!! makes you want to vom in your lap. Maybe you don't want to go to a sparkly daytime brunch party with shrieking 22 year olds for fear that your back might give out as you attempt to hide your age by gyrating to the DJ's Spotify mix. Maybe you don't want to have to endure a *YoGa SeSsiOn* just to meet some goddamn friends. Yoga sucks; you fucking hate yoga.  

And maybe you just want to meet some normal, chill, fun girls with whom to knock back a few gallons of wine and/or binge watch all that HBO has to offer. So this group is for all ye jaded ladies in your late 20s and early 30s who just want to make some friends who are just as tired as you are :) 

Will try to list different events to address issues with  availability / locations / whatever the fuck limitations all of your guys have, but feel free to suggest some yourselves!



SO I only got the basic subscription aka I can only add 50 people. Let us know  whyyyyy you should be chosen! 

May the odds be ever in your favor.

THESE ARE THE MEETUPS THAT YOU WON'T FIND EVERYWHERE ELSE!

results.description: This group is for professionals working in nonprofits or anyone interested in networking within the nonprofit industry. Those meetups are organized by bitCharities and held twice per month in BitCharities office in Manhattan, NY. What is bitCharities? www.bitcharities.com bitCharities democratizes charitable giving by connecting brands, non-profits and donors. bitCharities.com gathers large scale data on its entire user and donor base and shares it at no cost with the participating charities so that they can scale their fundraising efforts with larger corporate sponsors. bitCharities gives back 100% of the donations gathered on its platform to the charities. While donors can easily, simply, and publicly support a wide range of charitable organizations, brands can align their philanthropic efforts with their customers. bitCharities can engage the first party brand's database and activate them to participate in charitable donations, creating global awareness and a call for action even before any money is spent.
results.name: Non-Profits Professionals Network

results.description: This is a support group for friends and family members of people suffering from borderline personality disorder. BPD is a stressful condition that causes great pain in the sufferer as well as the people who are closest to him/her. Until recently, there's been a tendency for professionals to blame parents for their children's disorder, which further burdens family members. Parents need to find ways to maintain their equilibrium in order to help their struggling children. Partners and spouses of people with borderline personality often question whether they should stay in their relationships. Children whose parents have this disorder have complicated issues that carry over into adulthood. We're hoping to share our experiences with other people who've 'been there' and to find ways to live more fully and more peacefully.
results.name: Family and Friends / Borderline Personality Disorder

As parents who have chosen to live in South Orange/Maplewood, we understand this, as well as the fact that when we as adults get to know all of our neighbors, it helps to reinforce the ideals we hope to instill in our children. We hope you’ll join us!

results.description:
This group represents the merger of Programming & Entrepreneurship.

We will be heavily focused on the BUSINESS side of web development, specifically our members are:

Looking to land better clients, larger clients, or more clients.

Looking to reduce the time and effort it takes to manage each web development account.

Looking to drastically increase their compensation for each and every project you work on.

Looking to potentially scale up your one-man operation to become a full-service web development agency.

This group will give you all the tools and know-how to identify, attract, land, and efficiently manage your IDEAL web development clients while earning absolute top-dollar for doing so.

We'll also discuss merging additional core, complementary, and passive service offerings to your foundation development skill-set

For those looking to market, sell, and monetize your own software and apps, we'll discuss the optimal strategies to do so.  

For those that are looking for something a bit more traditional, we'll also assist in hacking the job search process to help you land your ideal full-time development position.

We will also discuss how to generate even more PASSIVE income by creating and selling your own web development instructional videos online.

Lastly, we'll be chatting about the merger or Technology & Marketing, for those interested in the field of Growth Hacking. 

This group is a companion to The Business of Web Development course (which is free for a limited time) at www.ortiz.io

results.description:
CALLING ALL "BEAGLE PEOPLE" AND THEIR BEAGLES, IN BROOKLYN... AND BEYOND!!!

Rusty, my 1 year old Lemon Beagle, would love to make friends with other Beagles so that they can run around in packs (like they were originally bred to do during those Royal Rabbit Hunts hundreds of years ago in England) and play at the various dog parks and dog runs in Manhattan Beach, Bay Ridge, Dyker Heights, Park Slope, Brooklyn Heights, Prospect Park, Williamsburg and at other dog-friendly venues in New York City! 

(Our Members are always encouraged to recommend safe, fully fenced or leash-free, dog-friendly venues for our MeetUps.  We are constantly looking for new places to explore!) 

Rusty doesn't care if his Beagle cousins are purebred or mixed breed... or if they live in Brooklyn or Lynbrook!  He just wants to have fun, run free and howl into the wind with his like-minded relatives... no matter how young or how old they may be!  (Beagle puppies are welcomed too!!)

You see, whenever we've visited a dog park or a dog run lately, it's Rusty who usually ends up "being chased" by other non-Beagle dogs... instead of "being in a chase", as his genes beckon.  Other breed dogs tend to confuse Rusty's howling for aggression... instead of the excited, friendly greeting it really is!  It's all very perplexing to him, of course, and I hope to change all that with this Club!  

Note:  Membership in our Brooklyn Beagles Club is totally FREE and Beagle People from anywhere in the world are more than welcomed to join!  So please ignore the "Chip in" icons on the MeetUp.com website... I am covering all expenses and monthly fees to maintain this Club on MeetUp.com!

If distance makes it difficult (or impossible) for you to attend any of our MeetUps, we can all still benefit from your participation in our Discussion Forums in order to enhance our collective Beagle Wisdom for the benefit of our canine kids.  After all, that's what this Club is all about... to improve the lives of our Beagles, no matter where they may be!

When you join, you can request to have your very own, totally free, personalized Photo Album created specifically for your Beagle(s) and located on our Club's "Photos" section.  Simply respond to the first three very short Member Profile questions when you join so that we may have the details we need to create your customized Photo Album.  You can then upload as many photos onto it as you like! 

If you'd rather not have a Photo Album created for your Beagle(s) yet, that's OK too!  Just indicate your preference at the time that you join.

Our Club is unique in that our Members agree NOT to sue other Club Members for any potential liability claims resulting from their participation in a scheduled MeetUp Event.  This added peace of mind is a benefit afforded to ALL of us by your acceptance of our Waiver of Liability Agreement (WLA) if you plan to attend any of our scheduled MeetUp Events.  The 4th (and last) question posed to you when you join our Club relates to this item.

Our WLA protects ALL of our Members in ways that membership in other MeetUp Groups/Clubs do not! 

You can review this document by clicking on the "Pages" section of our website, scrolling down to the Table of Contents and clicking on "Waiver of Liability Agreement"... or, just click on the link below:

http://www.meetup.com/BrooklynBeaglesClub/pages/WAIVER_OF_LIABILITY_AGREEMENT/

We have our own YouTube Channel ("Brooklyn Beagles Club") where we post videos of all the dog-friendly venues we typically visit, as well as those which we plan on visiting in the future.  You can also subscribe for free to our YouTube Channel to stay up to date on all of our Club videos in one convenient location!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQ7gBkmSBkKNyiAaWOqQS1Q

All of our MeetUp Events are held at public venues with NO admission fees.  Our "Beagle Bashes" are usually scheduled either bi-weekly or monthly.  On occasion, our Members may be invited to attend other Beagle Group MeetUps.  It's all about giving our Beagles the opportunity to socialize as often as possible... and with as many Beagles as possible!

So join NOW to get FULL access to our Club's MeetUp Event details, location maps, our Discussion Forums, past MeetUp postings and videos, Club MeetUp photos, Member Photo Albums and much more!

Let's get ALL of our Beagles together in one place so that they may run free and howl to their heart's content!  It will be utterly glorious!! 

ARUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU!!!

https://youtu.be/RlhwYVDbO3A
results.name: Brooklyn Beagles Club

results.description:
If you like water sports and being out under the sun, or you just like trying new things, join us for our Open Boat Event on Sunday, June 14, 2015 at the World’s Fair Marina in Flushing, New York at 11 AM.

Dragon boating is a sport with a long history, starting in China, which has translated into the new millennia as an organized sport that is rapidly growing in the United States as well as internationally. Unlike kayaking or paddle boarding, both which are fun but more solitary water sports, dragon boating has an added aspect of team building.  The dragon boat is roughly 40 feet long with the capacity to hold 20 paddlers, a steersperson and a drummer. To move this boat quickly and efficiently those 20 paddlers must paddle in tandem in the same direction with the same goal.

If you are interested please come out to our event and get the full dragon boat experience. As a women’s team the coaching is tailored and adjusted to maximize the unique strengths that women can bring to the sport. We also encourage larger groups, such as professional teams and organizations who need a team building exercise to come out and join us for our “Open Boat” day.

What is provided: Dragon boats, Paddles, PFD (Personal Floatation Device), Coaching/ instruction, storage for small bags and keys

Please wear: temperature appropriate (remember most days the sun is beating down on us) clothing that is either dry- fit or fast drying. Please do not wear heavy materials (denim) or cotton as they are liable to get waterlogged and uncomfortable very quickly. A hat. Sunglasses. Sunscreen. Water resistant shoes (flip flops are fine)

Please bring: A bottle of water (you will need to hydrate). A change of clothing (in the case that you do get wet)

Women in Canoe is a 501(c)3 sporting organization that was established in 2000 by women, for women to realize their full potential starting with a healthy lifestyle in a supportive environment centered around the sport of dragon boating. Inherently the sport fosters collaboration and teamwork (making a boat that is over 40 feet long and 500+ lbs, not including the paddlers, move is no small task). The team has since continued in its commitment to the community by following its mission to foster the well-being of women from all backgrounds and all ages. We are proud to be a reflection of our home base, Queens, in our diversity and fortunate enough to be multi-generational, as we value experience as much as exuberance. (We find that one tends to rub off on the other ^_~ and vice versa)
results.name: Women in Canoe- Women's Dragonboat Team

MISSION
Our mission is to help women in tech broaden their networks to improve their success.

VISION
We envision a more inclusive tech community, drawing more women to join tech companies and technical professions. We aim for a future in which the technology industry in NY more closely reflects the diverse community in which we live.

PURPOSE
We are here to help women make new connections and friends.

“Network ties build social capital and are key to career opportunities and advancement.”

Personal networks are one of the largest contributors to career success. Yet, forming these connections can be difficult for women who work on mostly-male teams and participate in mostly-male industry groups.

Our part in this industry is simple, yet has potential to achieve powerful outcomes.

results.description:
Primary Aim: To get at least one Pathfinder campaign underway and form a consistent biweekly group. We'll be meeting Sunday afternoons at 1pm and play until 7pm; perhaps slightly later.

Secondary Aim: To get a consistent group to meet at least once a week and get at least 2 seperate campaigns underway. (it's fun the GM but I also like to play as well)

The  game I shall host at my house. I run a pretty liberal game and am not intimated by min-maxing or those classes or items thought to be "too powerful". Note: I have 4 small dogs (very friendly) so if you're allergic to dogs please don't join.


Character Creation:
Every character starts off with a 10 in each stat.
From 11-14 it costs 1 point per stat increase
From 15-16 it costs 2 points per stat increase
From 17-18 it costs 3 points per stat increase (max base stat is an 18 before racial modifier)
Thus, to have an 18 it would cost a total of 14 points. Since I like Heroic campaigns the starting point value is 25 and one can opt to gain additional points by lowering some stats (no lower than to an 8 before racial modifier). Each stat lowered grants a 1:1 point ratio.

If you have a character in mind that you'd like to play, feel free to message me and I'll work as best as I can with you.

If you're considering on running an additional campaign, by no means feel that you have to cater to my character creation method.  However, if you: like to run a"lower powered" campaign (speaking about stats) than Pathfinder Society games (PFS cumulative stat bonus, prior to racial modifiers, is a 7); don't allow the majority of the official Pathfinder classes/feats found in the plethora of Pathfinder resources (not speaking about 3rd party material...even I don't allow that); and or are stuck in the very novice GM mindset that it's the GM vs the Players...then do us all a favor and please don't offer.

results.description:
Futsal - is a game played between two teams of five players each, one of whom is the goalkeeper. Unlimited substitutions are permitted. Unlike some other forms of indoor soccer, the game is played on a hard court surface delimited by lines. Futsal is also played with a smaller ball with less bounce than a regular soccer ball  due to the surface of the field. The surface, ball and rules create an emphasis on improvisation, creativity and technique as well as ball control and passing in small spaces.

Come join us for Open Pick-Up Futsal EVERY Thursday night from 9pm-11pm. We will have (3) 5v5 games going simultaneously so we can limit the amount of people that need to sit out. If you love our Open Soccer during the winter, you're going to enjoy Open Fustal just the same! Let's Play!

results.description:
Introduction

My name is Mark Abrams. I’m interested in starting an educational Role Playing Game Club in the area.  As a member of the Professional GameMaster Society, I believe that RPGs are a wonderful pastime, and at the same time also can be a very creative teaching-learning experience as well.  I started playing RPGs when I was a freshman in High School, and started GamesMastering in at that time, way back in 1978.  So I have quite a bit of experience with creating fabulous adventures in the realm of the imagination and playing them out as wondrous Campaigns in the often astounding World of Elthos.  I've run a number of educational RPG programs for kids in the area in the past, and would like to build on that foundation to create a truly unique and wonderfully creative educational experience for kids in the future.

Style of Play

I play fairy tale and medieval fantasy campaigns, with a bit of science fiction mixed in here and there, which makes it suitable for children as well as adults.   I customize my game according to the age and interests of my Players. My emphasis has always been on the quality of the storyline, and the enjoyment of the players. My goal is to provide the Players a sense of team spirit, critical thinking, good sportsmanship, the benefits of investigation, planning, organization, and the perils and rewards associated with risk taking, determination, courage, and fair play.  I will also be endeavoring, within the context of the game, to expose the players to certain educational materials, such as classical artwork and music (with brief discussions) as well as history, philosophy, and where applicable, science and math.  This is all done in the frolicking world of Elthos where adventures involve battling giants and dragons, or exploring realms beyond the far reaches of the known world, depending on what the young heroes decide to do with their Characters in the game World.  It’s a truly fabulous way to learn!

Elthos: The RPG System 

I created the first version of the Elthos RPG in 1978. It is a system of my own design based off of the original version of D&D.  In recent years I distilled down my original Elthos system to a much more efficient mini-system that makes for greater ease-of-play, and then went on to program the mini-system as an online application named The Mythos Machine.  It serves to make my games highly efficient for both myself and my players.

The Arrangements

I can either play via an online venue using Roll20 or similar Virtual Table Top software, or in person, depending on the preferences of the Players.  For local in-person games, because there is an theatrical aspect to the playing of Role Playing Games, atmosphere is an important factor.  Particularly lighting and the coziness of the play area makes a significant difference.  A table for players to use as a writing surface is required as well as a table for the GameMaster.   I would favor a consistent time and location for the games as that would make it easier on everyone for scheduling and transportation.  I would run 1 game sessions per week for any given group of players.

Pricing 

$10.00 / Hour per Player (minimum of 6 players, maximum of 12)

The Club Rules 

Place and Time: Games will be held on the Second and Fourth Sunday of each month at the specified time and location.

Players:  There can be a minimum of 6 and maximum of 12 club players during a given game.  A Club Player Waiting List can be created if necessary. Elthos games are appropriate for young adults between the ages of 11 and 15. 

Player Attendance: Players who can not attend the game should contact the GM by email or cell phone to let the GM know that they won’t be able to make it. They may at that time assign any character(s) that they have in the current game to be played either by the GM or another Player at their discretion. If no contact is made then the character(s) will be played at the GM’s discretion.  Players who do not show up for three consecutive games may have their position replaced by someone on the waiting list, and their Character may be assigned the status of “Red Shirt” (most players will understand what that means).

Payment:  The club game fee will be collected on a per game basis at the standard rate, payable through the Meetup website. 

Code of Conduct: Players must behave in a polite manner toward other Players and the GM at all times or they may be benched for the game. Good sportsmanship will be emphasized.  I'll do my best to take this club in the direction that the majority of members seem to want to go. I'll often ask for member input into various happenings in the club and I'll be receptive to ideas and criticisms by members regarding the club. However, if I find that a member is acting in such a way as to disrupt club activities or ruin other member's enjoyment of the event, that member will be dismissed from the Club.

Arbitration/Disputes:  The GM will arbitrate all game related disputes and those decisions must be considered final. 

Well, let me know if this plan seems good to you, or if you have any suggestions.  I look forward to hearing from you.


Sincerely Yours,

Mark Abrams,

Professional GameMaster Profile

of The Professional GameMaster Society
results.name: Elthos Game Club

results.description:
Inspiration is vital for expressing your ideas in words, and getting in touch with your intuition and quiet inner voice for inspiration is a key part of the process. In this group, you'll do guided meditations, creative exercises, Haiku writing, and story-catching to get past your analytic mind and learned conventions and express your ideas more creatively from your spirit or intuition. To help you with this, I'll teach you the art of joriki, a Zen term for illuminating the light or spirit within and blending with the light of the source or spirit without. Learning to write from this place also helps you see the world from a more inspired and intuitive place, which in turn deepens the expression of your writing.

This group has a heavy emphasis on spirituality, meditation, learning to live intuitively, and learning to connect with your own spirit from where your inspiration flows. It is not about manuscript critiquing or the business of publishing.

About me: I'm a a published author, an award nominated scriptwriter and journalist, with a career ranging from an Iraq War correspondent to lifestyle and spirituality feature writing. My work has been featured on BBC, NPR, McClatchy News and the Huffington Post.

I combine my writing ability with these faculties to access the wisdom of the spirit to create work that is healing for me and for many around me. Using intuition to find that point of inspiration both inside and out in all circumstances has always been important in my work.

Many people have been astonished with the originality and beauty of the work they have produced during these classes. While it can be intense, this is a thoroughly enjoyable and creative class. No writing experience is needed and sharing your writing with the group is entirely optional.

A note on places: (1) Places are limited to ensure everyone has the opportunity and attention needed to develop and explore your own inspiration and creativity. I also need to pay for the room in advance, so please pay via paypal [karen at celticmedium.com] or Meetup when you RSVP. (2) RSVPs must be received 24 hours before the meetup. (3) If you want to pay at the door, please email me to confirm that there is a place open. (4) Because of the logistics and overhead involved in handling a meetup, anyone who RSVPs yes and is a 'no show' twice will be removed from the group.

results.description:
“The way of a superior man is three-fold: virtuous, he is free from anxieties; wise, he is free from perplexities; bold, he is free from fear.”  

Who we are? 

Men UP is a Meetup for MAN ONLY. We are here to exercise our man brain to become the best of who we are through discussions, exercises, presentations, and real-world application. We are here to support each other in our path to grow, to explore the potential that’s already inside of us. We accept all working professionals regardless of race, cultural background, religion, or age

Who should join? 

Men working professionally who are looking for an environment to grow in four areas: Women, Money, Work, and Health. This is an environment for man to share and explore experiences and learn from each other. This is a no judgment zone. We are here to make friends and help each other. This is a place where you have no limits and do not have to pretend to be something you are not.

Why you should join us? 

- If you would want to improve yourself with women, money, work, and health 

- If you want to make like-minded friends. 

- If you feel like you are not enough. 

- If you want to have a solid support system. 

- If you want to be in an environment where its perfectly okay to be yourself outside of your office and home. 

- If you are into self-improvement. 

- If you want to be the best version of yourself. 

- If you want to be in a group of friends who will not judge you for sharing who you are. 

Or 

- You are a badass in life that can guide you fellow man to improve and be more effective in life.

Bro Code

- This is a no judgment Zone. It means we accept all Men regardless of who they are and what they do. 

- When you join, you are required to attend the first meeting. 

- Every Man must attend one meeting per month. 

- 100% of your participation is essential. We don’t need an audience. We need men who want to spend this valuable time improving. 

- Each meeting cost $10 per person, which is only to cover space rental, learning material, and outside speakers. 

- If you cannot attend a meeting, you must cancel your RSVP THREE DAYS IN ADVANCE. 

- Three strikes out.
results.name: Men UP

You wanna climb on the mountain? Climb, while you dance. You wanna Fight with your obstacles? Fight with a dance. Dance at the edge of the abyss. Dance your sadness, Dance your pain, Dance your cry, Dance your fear! Allow yourself to feel curious to feel sadness to feel pain to feel everything that comes to you. Allow yourself to be loud, to scream, to laugh... Allow all of ur qualities good or bad.... Embrace them, and let go the things you need to let go, Let yourself feel free! And Just Dance.......Let your spirit Dance. Feel the lightness, weightiness when you Dance. Express yourself fully, Leave All the stories you created about yourself behind... Now go deep down to your soul.... And tell your true story by your spirit Dance... Dance your Love!

results.description:
Welcome to headaches, dizziness, anxiety, and this thing I can’t explain! This meetup is designed for anyone who is suffering from any variety of health issues. This can range anywhere from chronic headaches, to visual disturbances, to depersonalization, and anything else that you may be seeking an answer for. This group is meant to be a support system and a place where we can share our experiences and offer suggestions on things we’ve tried that might help others. Topics I hope to cover include conventional treatments, alternative therapies, nutritional health, and spiritual health. The goal is to heal as completely as possible. In addition, I hope to plan fun things for us to be able to do as a group.

A little about me:

My name is Alan and for 14 years, I was suffering from a number of health issues. This included chronic headaches, dizziness, anxiety, digestion issues, cognitive issue, insomnia, visual issues, and TMJ issues, just to name a few. I was also experiencing this pervasive feeling that something just wasn’t right, although I could never pinpoint what it was. I spent many years trying all kinds of treatments and therapies to no avail. I’ve been to every type of doctor out there and tried every alternative, nutritional, and spiritual remedy imaginable. A little over a year ago, I finally came across a therapy that has helped me tremendously. I’ve finally been able to overcome most of what I was experiencing. The hardest part throughout everything was never having anyone to talk to. I know how hard and lonely the journey can be, and wanted to create a group where anyone and everyone who might be going through their own ordeal can turn to for support.

My hope is that we can become a family that grows together, and ultimately have an impact on each other’s journeys.
results.name: Headaches, dizziness, anxiety and this thing I cant explain

results.description: Christian Kirtan in NYC Kirtan or kirtana, in Sanskrit, traditionally means “praise or eulogy”, referring to the call-and-response chanting performed during bhakti religious worship, in which instruments such as the harmonium (a pump or reed organ), khol drums or mrdanga, karatalas (small cymbals), and shakers are employed along with singing to carry along harmoniously daily chanting obligations. The Christian Kirtan meetup group is going to exemplify the spirit of religious devotional chanting except using mainly Christian tunes and lyrics offset by instruments. However, the group will not be closed to spiritual fusion, or the incorporation of tunes from other cultures, such as Irish, French, or Indian, during rehearsal and performance. The main idea is to combine the Christian spirit and kirtan music, hopefully on a weekly basis, if not more often, throughout the year, whether outdoors or indoors in NYC. Later, when our members are consolidated, we can consider doing weddings and performing other events. We are going to experience the joy of kirtan, Christian-hearted, and then spread it to other people by setting a good example, loving our neighbors while disseminating peace, music, and spirituality. Sign up and be joyous!
results.name: Christian Kirtan

results.description:
Through our collective knowledge, we can achieve success beyond our wildest dreams! This Meetup's goal is to create a DreamBuilder MasterMind of learners and teachers who want to take action and build their dreams in order to enjoy a richer, fuller life experience. The programming for this Meetup will consist of:

1.  The Vision Workshop: 3 Keys to Accelerating Your Success, (presented on a regular basis throughout the year by Chris Shuff). You will learn:

·  Strategies to discover the best steps toward your dreams and goals.

·  What powerful people do that creates sustained success. 

·  Simple thinking approaches that will guard you from fear, doubt and worry.

·  A 5-point test for determining whether your dream is right for you.

·  The main factor that causes you to lose steam, and how to stay motivated and overcome it.

2.  Workshops and Speakers from inside and outside the group on topics related to life transformation and DreamBuilding.

3.  Networking, socializing and group discussions of interest.

If you are committed to personal growth and development, as well as, moving beyond inertia and taking action, you will love connecting with our members and coming to our empowering meetings. Join me and other DreamBuilders as we explore ways to create a better reality and live the life we love living!

To Your Success!

Chris

results.description:
Lavender Space is an open-level vinyasa yoga class that usually meets from 7PM to 8PM every Monday (60 minutes). All skill levels are welcome.

I started the class from realizing that there were not many affordable yoga classes with small group setting, especially during the after work hours. Come join me on the mat to simply do vinyasa yoga in a state-of-the-art studio. The studio is conveniently located in Union Square area. The size of the class is always 10 yoga practitioners max. You will move and breath in carefully curated music. Mats and props will be provided. Towels and waters are not provided. The only thing I ask from you is to reserve your space early and avoid last minute cancellation so the space can be given to someone else. Just come wearing something that's comfortable enough to move in and you already have everything you need.

About the organizer: I am a yoga practitioner of 5 years and a 200hr Certified Yoga Instructor living and working in NYC. Outside of yoga, I have a full time job which I love and a supportive group of love ones so on most days I am happy. But just like everyone who lives in this city, the pressure of the daily life can be overwhelming and difficult to manage sometimes. Through the regular practicing of yoga, I frequently discover new ways to keep my life balance, maintain self control and create more space to care for others; and I want to share my practice with you. It is my way of paying it forward.
results.name: New York Lavender Space Yoga Afterwork

results.description:
Get support on your journey home. Our intention is Being, Modeling & Sharing Community Love, Habits & Lessons. 

The waking journey has many paths, roads and communities. We are not "a" community, we are merely practicing it... come join us every week as we gather to marvel our advances in technology and global communications, honor our experience as human beings and cultivate reverence for life and each-other.

Ultimately, we are gathering to integrate everyday being experience as sacred.

Every Tuesday, 6pm - 7:45pm, we share community love, wisdom and inspiration @ the Center for Remembering & Sharing in Union Square NYC. 

Come join us here for an evening where we sanctify time itself and re-claim our inner-space as sacred and get community support on the journey home - the freedom to format our life around what we love and be supported by it. 

In the words of the architects Masa Sono and Ostap Rudakevych,

"Transcendence emerged as a common element in the various activities. During meditation, one leaves behind everyday reality to enter into an empty space, free from pressure, desires and needs. We decided the form of the space should recede and disappear, as if a fog had entered the space and obscured its limits.
results.name: The Courtyard: Community Support on Your Spiritual Journey

results.description:
Thriving in Professional Services is founded to create a vibrant community of passionate females who are interested in meeting with motivated and interesting young professionals and expanding their network.

Recognizing the challenges women face in advancing their careers in the professional services space (see link) often due to the demanding work culture, the goals of this group are as follows:  

1. Enable the participants to learn about different industry focusses within  professional services, careers, organizations and more importantly, tips and advice for career development. It is not simply acquiring business cards and adding names to your “LinkedIn” account – it is taking the time to getting to know people in the areas in which you are interested or want to learn more about and staying in touch with them throughout your career. 

2. Initiate the creation of series of events focused on professional development through speaker series, hands-on skill development workshops, and mentorship opportunities to help overcome the specific challenges faced by women. 

3. Create a platform to practice the soft skills in a conversational and friendly setting. Most of us know our weaknesses, whether we need to be more organized or do a better job of meeting deadlines or simply prioritizing in a smarter way. Putting effort into improving those skills will make the attendees more marketable and promotable no matter what field they are in or would like to pursue. 


Links to some articles focusing on providing advice to women in the professional services space:

http://www.bain.com/publications/articles/lessons-from-female-leaders-in-professional-service-firms.aspx

http://www.mckinsey.com/insights/organization/lessons_from_the_leading_edge_of_gender_diversity
results.name: TIPS NYC: Thriving in Professional Services

results.description: We are a group of good guys and gals ! This group is intended for guys or girls that have a DUCATI bike or bikes that they actually ride. I will approve each member that joins this closed group and if you don't currently own a DUCATI, please go buy one and comeback. After you become a member, you are committing to attend a minimum of two rides per season. if you do not meet this minimum requirement you WILL be kicked out (I don't give a crap if you get mad since I am the one who pays for this shit). In addition, every member will be rated by one of the group's organizers and assessed either an A, B or C RIDER, as detailed below: * A-RIDER: Someone who is comfortable on his/her two wheel machine. Is able to keep up at a spirited pace if conditions allow. An A-RIDER is expected to receive NO guidance and/or direction on any given group ride and is expected to know all safety rules and formations. Group leader will NOT sit and wait for an A-RIDER. * B-RIDER: Someone who can ride and "for the most part" is comfortable on his/her two wheel machine. A B-RIDER is expected to receive a minimal level of guidance and/or direction on any given group ride and is expected to know all safety rules and formations. Group leader WILL wait for a B-RIDER. * C-RIDER: Someone who is in the process or beginning stages of getting comfortable with his/her two wheel machine. A C-RIDER is to receive all needed guidance and/or direction on any given group ride and is expected to be a great listener and adhere to safety rules and directions. Group leader WILL wait for an C-RIDER for as long as is needed.
results.name: EAST COAST DUCS

This group is for foodies who love to cook. Although we may also have activities for going out to dinner. However, my main hope is to build a group of people interested in cooking and getting together for dinner. Ideally, this is for those living in or near the East Village because this is also a way to meet your neighbors. Here's how this will work:

1) A dinner theme for the event is proposed, a likely location provided. Location will be someone's home, or, perhaps, picnic in the park (all ideas welcome).

2) Those interested in the theme sign up (RSVP).

3) The organizer(s) comes up with the menu and dishes out responsibilities.

4) Want to attend but no time to cook? If there's room, maybe the organizer allows you to just bring some wine.

5) We get together, share the food, make friends.

This can be anything from potluck dinners to 12 course tasting menus. Probably not limited to dinners either. No rules!

Open to all: from anyone who simply wants to learn how to cook and needs an excuse to practice to professional chefs. Only requirement is a passion for cooking. results.description:
Have you been wanting to learn how to meditate? Or maybe you're an experienced meditater and are looking for a group of like-minded seekers to meditate with? Join us every Monday as we dive into the deeper teachings, then sit together for 45 minutes utilizing a myriad of meditation techniques that you can then utilize at home. No experience necessary! We offer a supportive community of new and experienced meditaters with the intention of diving deeper into the practice. Meditation is a journey of self-discovery. By making the mind calm and quiet, we can go deep within and discover who we really are. By doing so, we find lasting peace and happiness and learn how to effectively solve our life-problems and realize our highest aspirations.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Meditation & Kirtan: For New and Experienced - LES/E.Village

results.description:
MERRY MEET!

Journey with us, sharing the vision of unity with those who seek knowledge of the Craft.

We are a NJ based Pagan Network of many traditional and not so traditional choices.  We are here to share our views, happenings and events in an informal and fun setting once a month. 

If you are new to the Craft or a student of mine, your posts about events or questions about witchcraft/Wicca are important. 

We encourage vendors, readers, reiki practitioners and Pagan entrepreneurs to become part of the Spirituallightworks.com and or sponsors of this Meetup.  Many people read our page and this could be helpful to you.

All sister/brother witches and pagans have a right to be themselves without prejudice.  We support and encourage you to meet each other at our social events.

If you have serious interest in our local witchcraft workshops and classes then show up at our monthly Montclair Meetup. Watch the date and time on the event schedule.

Looking forward to a Crafty good time !

Lady Morgana, HPS

Organizer

results.description:
NYC LIVE! group is for anyone interested in streaming live video using apps like Periscope, Meerkat, or others.

In NYC LIVE! meet ups, we will:
SHARE and LEARN from our collective experiences.
HELP new streamers on how to get into live streaming.
DEMONSTRATE how to stream from the conception of the idea to the post-stream distribution.
TALK about the best case uses of live streaming.
REVIEW successful streamers' work and their strategies.
DISCUSS strategies for monetization and for raising awareness for individuals, organizations, and businesses.
HOST celebrity streamers and learn from their success.

Join us for the next NYC LIVE! meet up.  Sit back, listen, ask questions or stream with us.  

Want to know more about these apps?  Click below:
Periscope: https://www.periscope.tv
Meerkat: https://meerkatapp.co

If you have any questions, feel free to contact me:

Thanks!
Afşar Arda
Twitter: @AfsarArda

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in new, out of the box ways of: experiencing convergent thinking, being creative, building and fostering human connection & community. All ages and skill levels are welcome to connect with a community of artists and non-artists a like! I started this in 2012 with the original goal being to create a google street view map that 'skins' our digital perception of our communities with hand-drawn/illustrated versions of more human perceptions of the world around us. This is an annual outdoor event that is beginning in Nyack and will soon be traveling through our area regionally with a hope to expand nationally and then globally. 

As a Meetup group called 'Flash Mobbers' we will gather regularly pre and post  event dates to help facilitate, develop, expand and execute both the educational reach and interactive potential of the  Flash Sketch Mob events as they grow in quantity and geographical scope. 

You must be 18 years of age to become a Flash Sketch Mobber on Meetup.  However, Flash Sketch Mob events are annual 'family-friendly events'  in which you can register your children through billbatsonarts.com. Children under 18, who learn about Flash Sketch Mob through Meetup must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.

Be a part of something big! Join Flash Sketch Mob 2015 Nyack, NY today! http://www.eventbrite.com/o/nyack-ny-flash-sketch-mob-227...
results.name: FLASH SKETCH MOB

This group is for people who like fun and affordable events. We like to watch first run movies on the big screen at matinee prices, but who can't wake up in time for the matinee!! Members of our group get a steep discount when we pre-order tickets together (currently only valid at Regal and AMC theaters). So if you are planning to go see the next big blockbuster, and would like to join us to watch it, you will pay matinee-like ticket prices on the opening weekend.

We also do free video movie watching in mid-town with FREE alcohol (or BYOB) and potluck. We are open to multiple genres and encourage members to help organize events. So come join us for some of the summer's best movies.

In addition we host other events, eats, and trips around town.


Come join us!

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses

results.description:
Yoga quiets the mind & soothes the spirit. We mostly experience the feeling of Grief in our hearts & lungs- therefore I follow selected poses that support the heart 💚 chakra such as child's pose, the warrior series, camel & other self care mindful poses. Honor your Yoga experience ending in Savasana (corpse pose) the ultimate pose for grief with a guided Yoga Nidra Meditation. 
The Warrior Women's Grief Group is kept to a small practice...using blankets & props to allow you to sink into relaxation and reduce physical and emotional suffering. 
During Grieving allow yourself to practice in ways that nurture and serve you such as Gentle and Restorative Yoga with emphasis on your breath. 
Grief is the last act of love we give to those we loved. Where there is deep grief, their was deep love.
results.name: Warrior Women - Grief Restorative Yoga in Bergen County

results.description: Hi Everyone, I'm a long time DM/Gamemaster looking to start a gaming group in Astoria, Queens. I'd love to run the Midnight RPG which is based on D&D 3.5 rules and is essentially the world of Lord of the Rings if Sauron had won, and your character was part of the resistance. I'm also looking to run Dungeons and Dragons (3.5 or 5th edition), or a Call of Cthulhu campaign (which is essentially Xfiles during the 1920s with more of a slant on the horror element.) results.description: This community is devoted to providing a fun and educational location for members to get help with, as well as to work on fixing and/or upgrading their technology, whether it be their computer, laptop, cell phone, tablet or other electronic item. We also provide repair and upgrade services as well as spare parts and new technology to ensure a great experience. By repairing old items, we extend their shelf life and help fight e-waste. Do you love technology such as the cell phone in your hand? Join us, and be part of something great. PLEASE NOTE: Our community is FREE to JOIN, and FREE to attend most meetups unless otherwise noted.  The fee provides you access to SHOP TIME so you can bring in your electronics, sit down, use our tools and help, and GET IT FIXED!

results.description: 1-Stop Model Shoots offers scheduled shoots in the New York City area for those photographers interested in studio photography and shooting models in studio. These group shoots are geared toward any serious photographer (from student to aspiring professional) looking to build their portfolio and gain experience from a live model shoot. ﻿ These shoots offer a "1-Stop" approach for photographers; providing experienced models, makeup artist, lighting equipment, backgrounds and wardrobe at each shoot - all at a fraction of the cost of setting-up the shoot yourself. All you need to bring with you is your camera. ﻿ Additionally, attendees have a chance to network with other photographers, share ideas with each other and connect with models and crew (makeup artists, hair stylists and wardrobe stylists) for any future personal shoots. ﻿ Each photographer is permitted to use the images for self-promotion only (such as print and online work) and must sign a waiver at each shoot agreeing to this.

results.description:
About Us 
Focusing on marketing automation, the Mautic Meetup New York answers your questions about marketing automation or how to implement marketing automation in to your business. If you already know marketing automation, lead nurturing, lead generation, email or content marketing but have struggled with the high price SaaS solutions that exist on the market then you'll learn how Mautic as a free and open source alternative can meet all your needs. If you run a small business, medium business, or big business and still want to use the same types of tools that the enterprise guys do, you'll love Mautic. 

Topics 
The Mautic Meetup New York meets monthly to discuss all things related to marketing, both automated and otherwise. You'll learn how to improve your process and workflow in an informal and personal setting. 

Needs 
We're currently looking for sponsors and venue location to help us as we begin organizing things! If you're interested in sponsoring or helping us please send an email!

I started this group when my ex and his girlfriend referred to me as "old and fat" in court papers when they filed for custody of my 11yr old daughter. Yes, it was very painful-and at the same time I was transitioning to aesthetic nursing; so I began to use my knowledge and studies of aesthetic nursing to transform my body. Fast forwarding three years later and my ex and his girlfriend are still dragging me to court every two weeks or so-but now I look forward to showing up because I look stunning! and fabulous! and HOT! Let's get together to discuss and trouble shoot on strategies to replenish the body's natural decline in the production of HGH. Let's transform together!

results.description:
The Network for Women in Business was founded by Toni Coleman Brown in the Fall of 2011 and launched in January 2012 with a three-fold mission to train, connect and advance women in business. Our slogan is simple and it fits with our mission: "We Educate to Elevate Women in Business." We believe that TRAINING is the key to success for most women in business. However, most entrepreneurs do not take the time out to get the training that they need to take their businesses to the next level. The Network for Women in Business help business owners by providing them with the most up-to-date and cutting-edge training in all aspects and areas of business. It doesn't matter if you're a solo-preneur or an entrepreneur running a multi-million dollar company with hundreds of employees or a home-based business owner, we have something for you. 

We are gearing up to be the premiere site for training women in business in all aspects of business from getting started, writing business plans, to developing a social media strategy or PR strategy. Within no time at all, the Network for Women in Business site will be filled with an archive of training unlike any other. It will be the place you come back to over and over again, not only for the training but also for the CONNECTIONS that you will be able to make with our members. When we launched our Facebook page on December 15, 2011, we had no idea that by the 28th of the same month that we would have over 2,000 Fans! Our official launch is slated for the 15th of January 2012. By the time that date comes, we anticipate that we will be very close to having 5,000 Facebook Fans, which should easily translate into a very active membership base. 

Premium membership allows our members and their businesses to be highlighted in our member directory for the world to see. This will allow members to connect with the right people to help them grow. Members will be able to ADVANCE their businesses. By being a member of the Network of Women in Business you will be able to increase your production and sales as a direct result of taking advantage of our training. You will be able to see a measurable difference in your bottom line. You will be able to say..."Before I was on the Network my business was _____ and after joining the Network my business has increased by ____as a result of being on the Network."

Never before has there existed an online space like the Network for Women in Business.
results.name: NYC Small Biz Boot Camp for Women

results.description:
Open source has been gaining a lot of momentum lately as companies have realized the benefits of collaboration and open innovation. The top innovations in the market today are open source: Cloud Computing with Linux and Openstack, Big data with Hadoop, and Mobile with Android. Startups like Github, Cloudera, Docker, Elastic, and Acquia are proof that open source can be a smart business strategy. 

Who we are 

We are innovators, enthusiasts, technologists, developers, entrepreneurs and basically anyone who is interested in learning more or integrating open source software into their start ups, companies, and projects. 

What we do

The main goal is to get more startups using open source, understand why they use it and the advantages for using it.

What we walked about

Throughout our meet-ups several references to resources are made. These are documented on the "pages" tab of this Meet-up site.

results.description: The purpose of this group is to connect with folks who have an interest in self protection. A little about me: I've been studying combatives since the age of 13 (currently 43). I ve been a Fundamentals Level Coach with Blauer Tactical Systems (www.tonyblauer.com) since 2006. Over the course of my 30 year martial journey I've studied Boxing, Wing Chun, JKD, BJJ, Kali and Kinamotay. Additionally, I hold Personal Defense Readiness certifications in Weapons, and Ground Fighting. My approach to training is three dimensional with an emphasis on the micro-analysis of the emotional, psychological and physiological aspects of the ambush attack. When focusing on self preservation, it's imperative that one understands that weathering the components of a truly ballisic attack is beyond mastering any said technique or style of combat. Rather, it is a daily process of accepting and acclimating oneself to the asymmetrical, off -balance nature of the attack, embracing the chaos and then training to engage the necessary tools to neutralize the threat. What differentiates my training paradigm from others is that I don't promote teaching the body to conform to satisfy a martial art. Rather, I believe in using the body’s natural and instinctive movement patterns to help protect oneself within the close quarter range. This includes: • Utilizing the hard-wired, DNA of our body’s survival reflex to as the ignition switch to our movements • Non-gender, age, size, or occupation specific • All movements, are based on “functional movement” • All movements are elemental & fundamental to survival so we are preparing for the 'unknown & unknowable' This is a group for anyone interested  in true self defense. Self protection includes awareness, fear management, verbal and physical skills. It can/will include blunt weapons, fire arms, multiple attackers and confined spaces. I started this group in order to meet others that share the same passion. No prior training is required to join. If you have prior training, what you'll learn won't negate it. In fact, it will bridge the gap. DISCLAIMER: At the risk of sounding brash, PLEASE DO NOT JOIN IF YOU ONLY HAVE A CASUAL INTEREST. I'm looking to meet with people that have a SERIOUS interest  and who will commit to at least 2 hours  a week. Thanks.
results.name: Asymmetric Combat Self Protection

results.description:
The Barefoot Boogie is a freestyle dance which happens twice a month in New York City, on the second and fourth Saturdays of every month (note: special summer schedule! next dance July 25). We offer a relaxed, smoke- and alcohol-free environment where folks can freely express themselves in movement. If you've enjoyed any kind of conscious dance, ecstatic dance, 5 Rhythms, JourneyDance, contact improv, or any other kind of freeform dance, you'll enjoy the Boogie. (If you've never been to any of these things but just love to move and dance, you'll enjoy the Boogie too!) Come alone or bring your friends. You'll find us at the dance moving solo, with partners, and/or in groups. Dress as you wish, but please leave your street shoes at the door before hitting the dance floor. 

At every Boogie you'll hear a wide variety of music: R&B, funk, tribal groove, ambient, world beat, electronica, disco, dub-step, swing-hop, you name it. The Barefoot Boogie is held at the New York Insight Meditation Center, at 28 West 27th Street, 10th Floor (Buzzer #27). 

Admission is a sliding scale from $10 to $15. (If this cost is too much for you, please consider volunteering! Door shift volunteers will receive $5 off for one door shift and a free dance for 2 door shifts.) Kids are welcome, and 12 and under are free.  However, all children must be accompanied by an adult.  

See www.barefootboogie.org for more info.
results.name: The Barefoot Boogie

results.description:
Let's explore the five boroughs of NYC with a group of new friends! 

We'll wander through different neighborhoods, sampling food and drink and learning stories behind New York's cultural history. 

Get to know new neighborhoods, rediscover old ones, and find out how this city was transformed from an island of "many hills" to a major metropolis. Sample dumplings in Chinatown, falafel in Greenwich Village, and tacos in Hell's Kitchen. 

Learn about artifacts in the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Whitney, or the Brooklyn Museum that were once used as drinking games (we'll probably even have a drink ourselves!). 

Alicia Butler is a licensed NYC tour guide with a degree in art history. She blogs at www.aliciaslastmeal.wordpress.com


All attendees must be 18 years or older. Some events will have a minimum age of 21.
results.name: NYC Cultural Explorers

results.description:
Just Breathe Yoga is a program designed for all levels, beginners, the curious and communities. It provides a safe place to come together and practice the beautiful tradition of yoga. We use no gimmicks, follow no fads or alter the power of the Vinyasa style. Vinyasa means to flow and as we flow we focus on breath, proper alignment of the body (yes we do adjustments!), movement and the simple practice of unfettered yoga. Classes are taught by registered / certified teachers in our community studio located within the Trinity Presbyterian Church in Paramus, NJ.

Just Breathe is not a religious program but does incorporate the importance of mindfulness, breath work and a positive outlook on life. People are our focus and today so many people are caretakers of aging or disable loved ones, working impossible hours and trying to meet the challenges of everyday life. It is easy to become “unfit” as we struggle to fit into a frantic world. Yoga allows each one of us time to pause, breathe, and stretch as we come together.
results.name: Paramus  - Just Breathe Yoga

results.description: This group is being formed to spread the word about Angelic Reiki in those parts of the United States in which it hasn't yet taken root fully. This wonderful, powerful healing modality is practiced by a fairly decent number of healers in the U.S., but it seems not yet strongly represented on the East Coast. We, the organizers (Sharon and Louisa) are very passionate about Angelic Reiki and feel that Spirit is pushing us to spread the word, so that in a few years' time, Angelic Reiki will be well known to the metaphysical community. We especially want to reach out to those practicing other forms of energy healing and assure these healers that whatever form of healing you're already doing, that healing and Angelic Reiki are not mutually exclusive. So, for example, If you are a healer and practice Usui Reiki, you SHOULD learn Angelic Reiki so that you can add it to your arsenal. This is not about a competition!!! This is about spreading more Angelic love and influence.

results.description:
Join this group if you want to make everlasting friendships with smart, beautiful (inside and out) women who you can count on like sisters, and grow your social and professional network. Our outings will range from happy hours to brunches to dinners, but will also try to include activities that are active! (We keep ourselves fit so we won't  have to feel guilty about that cupcake! :p) I'm also interested in organizing co-ed mixers from time-to-time, for those who are interested. Let's start the fun! 

Regarding member dues: To be completely transparent, I don't want to make money off this, I just don't want to be paying out-of-pocket forever. It costs money to run this meetup group, initially, $9.99 + tax for the first 6 months (for upto 50 members). In order for me to keep this group going, I'm asking to please contribute a nominal fee of $5 (a year!) price of a latte! so that I can keep this group growing to unlimited members and to keep hosting. It costs $14.99 + taxes per month to have unlimited number of members.


PS: Meetup.com takes a percentage out of the $5 contribution, so only $4.12 goes towards the group. If 50 members contribute, we can keep this group going for 2 years! If there are any overages, I promise you, it will go to a plate of appetizers or drinks. Again, I'm not interested in making money off you ladies.


Thank you for your support and I hope you will continue to participate!

results.description:
The Westchester Cycle Club: We are recreational bicyclists who ride in Westchester, Putnam and sometimes Rockland and Dutchess counties in New York State, north of New York City. Most of our members are from New York City, Westchester and Putnam. We have all types of rides, sometimes even on dirt. The club has a ride catagory system: A to D for road rides plus M for mountain bike rides. We try to schedule a ride at every level every Saturday and Sunday, sometimes more than one as long as the start locations are far apart. We also often schedule rides during the week. For anyone new to the club or thinking about joining, we offer O (orientation) rides. During the season, we also have casual rides - flings, we call them - that start and end at the same location every Wednesday and Friday. On special occasions, we have multi-level rides that end with a catered group lunch.

There is a $20 annual membership fee.  Members get: Access to MyWCC, Ride reminders, Monthly Newsletter, Access to our Cue Sheet Library, Discounts at local bike shops.

We are a non-profit. 

For more information, check out our website:

http://www.westchestercycleclub.org/
results.name: Westchester Cycling Club - Cycling Meetup

We teach the all-new 21st Century Science & Hacks of Selling to Millennials, Gen'X'ers & Baby Boomers. Our modern sales training course shows the right way to target your message for your success and growth. We cover Millennial sales teams selling to GenX & Boomers, How Do Baby Boomers & GenXers Sell to Millennials, and How to Manage the Millennials Sales Team, drastically improving productivity.

Be the best, and close the deals. It's part of the incredible #SucceedFast program.

Who can teach you the true path to multi-generational success?  Successful Boomers & Millennials. We have the skills, and you will learn them!

You can't successfully sell to Millennials, Gen'X'ers and Boomers with the same tired, old methodology. You need 21st Century thinking to sell to 21st Century people. Selling is not some "magical tweek" or static "sales pitch," it's science, brain chemistry and proven technology. 


There is nothing else like the SucceedFast seminars and PopUpSelling sales training. Grow your business, increase profit, recruit and retain the best sales pros - Millennial, GenX & Baby Boomer. Jonathan, Boomer and an international trainer, lecturer, and proud Salesman will lead this exciting and essential program with professional Millennials, Harrison & Garrett.
