results.description:
Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis & Solis Alati is a magical, mystical and alchemical Order, manifested in the fall of 2002 A.D., and publicly opened at the spring equinox 2003. Our intention is to bring together some of the main esoteric streams and movements within the western hermetic tradition, under the apophthegm of the Rosicrucian ideal, as stated in the Fama and Confessio: a brotherhood, working in secrecy, focused on a sincere inner development of its members, thereby affecting the world at large, without any interest of financial gain. The name, Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis & Solis Alati, is in fact the name of two Orders; the first, Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis (S.R.C.), translates into 'The Secret Society of the Rosy Cross', thus representing the Rosicrucian flavour of the magical and mystical processes that lead the candidate to a full contact with his/her Holy Guardian Angel. The second, Sodalitas Solis Alati (S.S.A.), which translates into "The Secret Society of the Winged Sun", indicates the alchemical work that the adept is then ready for. Within these two Orders, the magical work and initiations of the Golden Dawn, Alpha & Omega and Rosae Rubeae et Aurea Crucis, the mystical work and initiations of Christian Theurgy and the alchemical work of the Royal Path integrates into a coherent system of personal unfoldment and development, where every step follows the next in a clear and consistent way. The purpose of the Order is the perpetuation and realization of the western Hermetic tradition in this new era. Our work is to bring forth the Light of our predecessors, our Mothers and Fathers in Gnosis, Who have perpetuated Truth through the traditions of the Rosicrucian Order, the Primitive Rites of the Egyptians, the Royal Art of the Alchemists, The Concealed Mysteries of the Kabbalists & the Gnosis of our beloved Lady Sophia. We invite you to read through the information provided on this site, as well as to contact the New York Circle if you want further information.

www.rosae-crucis.net

In L.V.X. Sub Umbra Alarum Tuarum, Yeheshua.
results.name: Golden Dawn - Sodalitas Rosae+Crucis et Solis Alati - N.Y.

results.description:
What is Break Diving? It's a mindset.  It's the lost art of finding and creating opportunity. Instead of waiting for opportunities to float to the surface, break divers DIVE IN to the cold, icy, and treacherous shark-infested waters of resistance and find their 'chance of a lifetime' in the muddy bottom where no one else dares to tread.

WHAT THIS MEETUP GROUP IS ABOUT:
The purpose of this Meetup group is to inspire members to pursue their dreams and find solutions to problems encountered along the way.  Think of it as a gym membership for your life.  This Meetup might also be considered life and business coaching in a fun group environment.  Bottom line, studies have shown that we become the type of person we hang out with the most.  So, come network, learn from, and be inspired by other winners just like you!  .

WHO SHOULD JOIN:
If you have big dreams, great ambitions, and outlandish plans... JOIN US.
If you want help and encouragement figuring out how to get from Point A to Point B... JOIN US.
If you want to do fun things with other people with the same positive mindset as you... JOIN US.
If you think you are good at solving problems and offering solutions to others on this path called life... JOIN US.
If you want to be inspired and motivated to be more, do more, and live more... JOIN US.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN:
Life is tough.  It's even harder when you're trying to accomplish big goals.  And well, it's nearly impossible to accomplish those big goals entirely by yourself.  So... why not share your goals and dreams with other winners and get their feedback?  Why not encourage others with your unique perspective on their situations?  EVERYONE needs encouragement and 'outside the box' thinking.  This group can provide that encouragement and outside-the-box thinking.  More importantly, you can provide that same fresh positive outlook to other group members.  A rising tide raises all ships.  So come join this rising tide of awesome people doing awesome things!  Monroe Mann (Bio below, or Google him) and his fellow Break Divers will inspire you, encourage you, and force you to think in ways you never could have on your own.  The result: your life is going to get a whole lot better.

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT AS A BREAK DIVING MEMBER: 
The basic framework of the group is meetings and get-togethers--inspirationally focused and moderated by motivational dynamo Monroe Mann, who many have called The Tony Robbins of the Entertainment World.  Our meetings are ALWAYS inspiring; always hands-on and practical; always future focused (i.e. YOUR future); and often have an adventure portion to them, i.e. a Citibike adventure in NYC that starts with a motivational pow-wow and finishes with an invigorating kick in the pants. 

More specifically, each meeting has a three-part focus:

FIRST: we start off with a motivational topic introduced by the moderator, i.e. your goals over the next month or year; or thinking about your life's biggest problem and how to solve it; etc. 

SECOND: we have a workshop portion during which you can talk and interact with fellow members, discussing the particular topic introduced earlier.  Sometimes the workshop may simply be sipping coffee and chatting, and at other times, it may be an outdoor activity like riding Citibikes or hiking, or doing some other fun activity like going to see a movie, or browsing the stacks at a bookstore.

FINALLY:  each Meetup concludes with a final motivational pow-wow to go over solutions to whatever problems were introduced during the beginning of the meetup.  During this time, everyone gets together and shares what they learned, and verbally and in writing, outlines their plans and to-do lists for the next few weeks or months.

The idea is that each Meetup will leave you encouraged and motivated, armed with solutions to whatever issues you are facing, and a battle plan for the next few weeks to tackle your goals and dreams.  More often than not, you'll also make new friendships and reinforce old ones.  

Regarding the activities: we might have writing workshops; we might meet at Broadway Dance Center; we might go for a walk in the park; we might go to Playland; we might simply meet for a chat to go over our one, three, and five year goals.  THE ACTIVITIES ARE MERELY A MEANS TO AN END: the activity becomes a casual and fun way to allow the wisdom and inspiration of the pre/post event pow-wows to percolate in your mind. 

Bottom line: the focus of Break Diving is simple--to guide one another to become our best by inspiring one another to overcome difficult challenges on the road to reaching our dreams.  In other words, this Meetup group's purpose is to help inspire you to DIVE into this crazy world and FIND YOUR BREAKS AND OPPORTUNITIES.  We want you to become... a Break Diver!

Sound good? 

If so, come join our collective of winners!  If you are ready to grab life by the horns and finally do what you know you were meant to do, welcome to your new home, and welcome... to the first day of the rest of your life.  Note: Membership requires application and approval.  If you already know two members, your application will be processed more easily.

MODERATED BY:

Monroe Mann, the founder of Break Diving, and a dude who epitomizes the philosophy of No Rules, No Excuses, No Regrets that he espouses. In his short life to date he has:

* written and published 8 self-help and business books, one of which is a Barnes & Noble # 1 bestseller
* served his country as an intelligence office in Iraq and was nominated for a bronze star
* produced and directed the now successful comedy horror film "You Can't Kill Stephen King" (available at Best Buy and Amazon Instant Video) and is listed on IMDb as an actor, writer, producer, director
* Lived in Europe for two years, China for one, and Iraq for one, and now speaks French, Italian, and Chinese--all at above conversational levels, and knows basic Arabic.
* Earned five advanced degrees: Juris Doctor, MBA, Masters in Entrepreneurship, Masters of Law in Commercial Real Estate, and is now completing his PhD dissertation in Psychology
* Earned his EMT, Lifeguard, and Wilderness EMT certifications and volunteered as such in Haiti after the earthquake
* Gone on a one-week dogsledding adventure, driven cross country from NYC to San Diego, traveled cross-country by Amtrak from Seattle to New York City, been to over 30 countries, won an ostrich riding competition in South Africa, dove with sharks in the Bahamas, played with falcons in Mongolia, performed on stage with New York City Opera, and the list goes on and on and on!
* Bottom line: he has given hundreds of motivational speeches to people and organizations around the world and helped change the lives of thousands, and he wants to help change yours for the better too!

Why does he want to run this meetup group?  Because his greatest joy in life is helping others to realize that "impossible" is just an excuse.  And when you get inspired, you will in turn be helping to inspire him.  Maybe most importantly, he likes making new friends with those who are also doing or trying to do great things with their lives.  It's a win, win, win!  So join, join, join!
results.name: Break Diving NYC - No Rules, No Excuses, No Regrets. (tm)

results.description: We are an inclusive collaborative of activists who will meet in hopes of bringing together New York City's important, if often disparate, movements. Our hope is to have these groups coordinate with one another as they fight against inequality and the commoditization of both the natural environment and human beings toward greater social justice. This may include, for example, coordinating demonstrations, recommending activist literature, or holding panel discussions about the key issues facing our society. This is a group for those who find writing sketches for screen media to be the most gratifying form of creative self-expression. 

It is also for those who want to take a big step further - to have their written sketches put on SCREEN.

Therefore, let's get together, let's read our work to each other, let's listen, laugh and share suggestions that might improve our writing, or give us other POVs that might in turn give new directions to our own funny thoughts and concepts. 

Let's also put our heads together and practice co-creating new work (as a team of would-be-writers of a running sketch-com series). 

Let's support each other's efforts to overcome an obstacle-course beyond which our audiences are awaiting our work. I foresee a number of very interesting opportunities that might come out this meetup. 

We'll meet once or twice a month at the Greenpoint own literary hub -- the "Word" book-store (126 Franklin St, Brooklyn, NY 11222 · 718-383-0096) or at another convenient location nearby. 

The next meetup is in the process of being scheduled. 

Come from anywhere in the city to our booming neighborhood with your piece(s) of writing.

Are you seeking a peaceful, compassionate, nourishing practice for the body and mind?   We are a community coming together in mindfulness.  Utilizing the context of a formal seated practice and Yin Yoga classes multiple times per week at Sangha Yoga Shala in Williamsburg, Brooklyn including upcoming retreats and workshops, this method of practice creates a balance in the system that optimizes health and wellbeing like no other.  By including this practice into your life, you will feel the benefits immediately on a physical, energetic and emotional level.

www.sanghayoganyc.com


Yin Yoga / We apply basic breathing and awareness techniques as we move through Yin postures in a slow and steady pace, holding passive postures for a few minutes at a time to nourish and infuse the yin tissues with blood flow. This method enhances chi flow into the connective tissues and nourish the meridians housed within them, creating a sense of relaxed calm and balanced energy. This class is acceptable for all levels of experience. 

Thursday / 10AM

results.description:
Controversy aside, Harper Lee is releasing the predecessor to "To Kill A Mockingbird" on July 14, 2015, and it is destined to be another classic. At very least, it will be widely read. Preorders are already on par with the anticipation that surrounded the release of the "Harry" Potter series.

So I thought it might be fun to create a book club to discuss. I am an intellectual property attorney and a former English graduate and I know my metaphors from my allusions. 

Join me?

You can purchase your copy of "To Set A Watchman," by Harper Lee, here.......

http://amzn.to/1Se4eMS

The Kindle Edition here.......

http://amzn.to/1GdqYFO

And if you want a beautiful set with both "To Kill A Mockingbird" and "To Set A Watchman," try this two-set edition from Amazon.......

http://amzn.to/1TqJqUK

Looking forward to meeting you and discussing!


Charlene/
results.name: "Go Set A Watchman" Book Club

results.description: This meet is for those men who read or reading or would like to read a book titled The Velvet Rage by Alan Down: Overcoming The Pain of Growing Up Gay in a Straight Man’s World. The book is second edition. It is available for purchase in any bookstore as well as ebook. We will explore the chapters in the book and talk about our own experience growing up gay. We will discuss anything you would like to pertaining to the book. I found that a lot of quotes from the book resonate with me. So start journaling. Group is to start meeting in September. The location will be announced at a later time
results.name: The Velvet Rage NYC Book Discussion Group
